name: Let's get it started!
description: This set gets you started on the basics of Ex Nihilo and how to generate resources to start your journey while Stranded!

quests.name: Slippery lil' fella's
quests.description: When using a crook to gather leaves, you might get a silkworm.  Use a silkworm on healthy leaves to infest them.  Once the entire tree is infested, use a crook to get string from the leaves.

tasks.longDescription: Get to crooking and get me some string!

quests.name: Roll up your Sieves
quests.description: Your primary method of gaining resources to start is a sieve.  Sieves do require you to us meshes of varying levels to gather different resources.  Hold the resource you wish to sift in your hand and right click on the sieve.

tasks.longDescription: Craft a sieve so you can start getting items from dirt.

quests.name: Mesh it up
quests.description: Keep in mind that different levels of mesh get you better and more resources.  You can upgrade your string mesh to flint, iron, and diamond.

quests.name: Hydrate me
quests.description: Bone meal is a fairly efficent way of speeding up crop growth.  But a watering can is easy and renewable.  Fill a watering can with water and just right click to increase the chances of growth.

tasks.longDescription: Obtain a watering can and fill it from the ocean.

quests.name: Let's get crooked
quests.description: Crooks increase sapling and apple drops to get started with food.  Also allows you to get silkworms so you can get started on making string.

tasks.longDescription: Get yourself a few logs so you can make sticks and craft your first crook.  (Hint, always check the JEI if you are unsure how to craft something).

quests.name: Barrel me over
quests.description: Barrels are a great way to compost materials into dirt, such as fish, food, and plant materials.  They can also collect water to make clay and other things later in the game.

tasks.longDescription: Craft a barrel to get started with composting materials.

quests.name: Everyday I'm Cobbling
quests.description: From sifting dirt, you will get many things including seeds, and pebbles.  Cobble is probably single most abundant resource you will be using to start, mostly to get other resources.

tasks.longDescription: Get to sifting and get yourself some cobble.

quests.name: Sittin' on the Dock
quests.description: Fishing is a great way to get food and organic material to make dirt, trash to smelt into iron, and even chests with advanced items.  More importantly, fish in a barrel will compost it into dirt.

tasks.longDescription: Make a fishing rod, then use it in a crafting table to convert it to an Aquaculture rod.

quests.name: Rocking Generation
quests.description: Once you have lava, you can collect it in an iron bucket.  Get enough iron for 2 buckets and make your first cobblestone generator.

tasks.longDescription: Craft a cobblestone generator, now you're moving along faster than ever!  Now it's time to look at Tinkers' and ExCompressum!

quests.name: Hammer time
quests.description: After you sift and gain your resources, you can make cobble.  A hammer lets you break that down into gravel, then sand, then dust.  Craft a hammer and get to whackin'.

tasks.longDescription: Use a hammer to gather a few resources.

quests.name: Let's get meshy
quests.description: Using different meshes will get you different resources and higher meshes get you more quantity.  Start with a string mesh and let's get to sifting.

tasks.longDescription: Crash a string mesh (remember, the JEI is your friend).

quests.name: Witch's brew
quests.description: Witch water is useful for creating nether variants of blocks and mobs.  Just put a barrel of water over Mycelium and get to brewing.

tasks.longDescription: Obtain an ancient spore by sifting.  Use the ancient spore to make Mycelium (hint, use the JEI to see which mesh you need).

quests.name: Barrels of fun
quests.description: Stone barrels operate the same as wooden ones but better.  You can also use stone barrels with lava to create additional resources.

quests.name: Crucible Cooking
quests.description: Make an unfired crucible and cook it in a furnace.  A crucible lets you put heat sources (or even radiated metals) under it to melt cobble to create lava.

tasks.longDescription: Fire up a cruicible to start making lava.

quests.name: Clay me a river
quests.description: Barrels don't just get you dirt from compost, it can also get you clay.  Clay is a key component to getting started on smelting in Tinkers', which is a faster and more efficent way to process your ores and materials.
